conclusion: Determine the maximum force F to keep A and B stationary relative to each other.
Block A is on top of block B, and a force F is applied horizontally to block B.
Block A has a mass of 1 kg and block B has a mass of 2 kg.
Maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N, and kinetic friction coefficient between B and ground is 0.1.
Calculate weight of block A: 10 N.
Calculate weight of block B: 20 N.
Normal force on block B is the sum of weights of A and B: 30 N.
Calculate kinetic friction force on block B: 3 N.
For A to remain stationary relative to B, static friction must counteract force F.
Maximum force F is the sum of static friction and kinetic friction: 4 N.
Final answer: F does not exceed 4 N.
